name: Kazoome
overview:
Kazoome is a website where groups can come together to share photos, watch videos, browse the web, and listen to music interactively, in real-time.

You can use Kazoome to, amongst many things:

  • Go online shopping with a couple of friends
  • Show a relative how to use a website
  • Look through photos together of a recent holiday
  • Plan a trip with a group of friends, looking at maps, hotel reviews and flight prices
  • Meet together with colleagues, both in and outside the organisation

Groups meet up in ‘rooms’ where each have avatars that allow both text chat and other forms of response an interaction like facial expressions, sounds and voting.

There’s no download and no registration.

Note: The service is still in development and due to be available for private beta soon.
